intro: Stigmaphyllon mucronatum, commonly known as the sharp-pointed stigmaphyllon, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in Brazil and Paraguay. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
